alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Elmore (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Autauga and Elmore. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen so far. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Bob Woodruff Lake, Autauga County Airport, Blue Ridge, Wetumpka Municipal Airport and Speigner.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
